fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: MetLife LTC LifeStage AdvantageSM

fields.name: Subtitle
fields.value: Plans-at-a-Glance

fields.name: Insurance Header
fields.value: INSURANCE | LONG-TERM CARE

fields.name: Company Name (logo)
fields.value: MetLife

fields.name: Plan Header - Simple Advantage
fields.value: SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM PLAN

fields.name: Plan Header - Custom Advantage
fields.value: CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM PLAN

fields.name: Simple Advantage - Plan Type
fields.value: Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)

fields.name: Issue Ages - Simple Advantage
fields.value: 18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: Issue Ages - Custom Advantage
fields.value: 18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)

fields.name: Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA) Header
fields.value: Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA)

fields.name: Optional Riders Section Title
fields.value: OPTIONAL RIDERS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGE

fields.name: Shared Care Rider - summary
fields.value: Insured and spouse/partner** can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted; When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost; Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies

fields.name: Nonforfeiture Rider - summary
fields.value: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums or is cancelled by insured; Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Available at initial application only

fields.name: Cash Benefit Rider - summary
fields.value: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO) Title
fields.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO) - summary
fields.value: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; Increases will not occur if insured is eligible for benefits; Rider ends at the earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday or when insured is no longer eligible to receive offers under this rider

fields.name: Benefit Increase Options Title
fields.value: BENEFIT INCREASE OPTIONS (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Future Purchase Option (FPO) - summary
fields.value: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year; Increases occur unless insured rejects in writing prior to the Policy Anniversary; Corresponding increase in premium for increase in coverage at attained age rates; If insured rejects two times in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases; Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting

fields.name: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders - summary
fields.value: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year, either 3% or 5%, with no corresponding increase in premium; Coverage increases continue while insured is eligible for benefits; Rider available at any time, with additional underwriting; Variants: 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider, 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider

fields.name: Footer Notice
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION.

fields.name: Footer Company Name
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company (MetLife)

tables.caption: Plan comparison (attribute / Simple Advantage / Custom Advantage)

rows.value: Plan Type
Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Issue Ages
18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA)
Multiple MBA/TBA options shown (e.g., $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K) and various total benefit amounts up to $500K/$1MM
Multiple MBA/TBA options shown (various MBA/TBA combinations; $1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: Section Header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services - Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limitations may apply; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage provided if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: Additional Information Header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal*; 15% Marital**; 15% Residential; 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) – 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: Underwriting Classes
fields.value: Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)

fields.name: Policy Effective Dates
fields.value: With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date

rows.value: Home and Community Care

Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services – Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Facility Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
Elimination Period
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative
Alternate Service Provision

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Bed Reservation
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason
Return of Premium
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate
International Benefit

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of listed limits; EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider added International Benefit modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days
Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse

Limited coverage provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of the total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date
Initial Needs Assessment

1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
Premium Waiver
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Coordination of Benefits
Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

tables.caption: Additional Information For All Policies (Key - Details)

rows.value: Payment Options
Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; may impact tax deductibility; consult tax advisor
Care Coordination Services

MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts; insureds can call for advice about caring for a loved one even if that family member is not insured with MetLife
Discounts
30% Spousal*; 15% Marital**; 15% Residential; 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84); Multi-Life Discount for approved cases
Underwriting Classes
Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard
Policy Effective Dates
With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date

TABLE_PAGE1.snippet: Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA) — Multiple MBA/TBA options shown (e.g., $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K) and various total benefit amounts up to $500K/$1MM

TABLE_PAGE2.snippet: Feature / Description table including Home and Community Care; Facility Care; Elimination Period; Bed Reservation; Return of Premium; International Benefit; Premium Waiver; Coordination of Benefits

reasoningNotes: Populated only fields with explicit evidence in the extraction JSON. Fields with no specific mention were set to null per rule.
Elimination Period fields mapped directly from the explicit '100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative' entry (high confidence).
Bed reservation mapped to facility bed reservation text (50 days per calendar year), and amount recorded as 'actual charges incurred' since that phrasing appears in the source.

MBA/TBA maxima derived from table examples. These are examples in the doc (e.g., $15K and TBAs up to $1MM); confidence is medium since the table lists multiple options and rider constraints (Cash Benefit Rider excludes $1MM).
Nonforfeiture/Contingent Benefit information combined from Nonforfeiture Rider summary (page 1) and Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse (page 2).
Care coordination, home care, homemaker, adult day care, hospice and facility care were populated from 'Home and Community Care' and 'Facility Care' descriptions (medium confidence).

Inflation protection populated under 'Compound Inflation' because the document explicitly references Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders (3%/5%); no explicit 'simple inflation' option was provided, so Simple Inflation was left null.
Where multiple related fields exist (e.g., Return/Refund of Premium and Premium Refund at Death), the same explicit source was used for both fields.
Two 'Additional Benefits' fields were left null because no other ad hoc additional benefit descriptions were present in the provided extraction.
All populated entries include source references (page and fieldId/tableId) and use confidence scores matching the extraction confidences (0.8 for high-confidence fields, 0.6 for medium).

prompt.system:
You are building canonical data for illumifin claims processing. You are given OCR extraction results (fields and tables) for a multi-page document along with page-level document type hints. Classify the overall content into one or more of: 'facility_invoice', 'cmr_form', 'ub04'. Input JSON includes a pages array where each page has fields with IDs, values, and normalized bounding boxes (x, y, width, height all between 0 and 1 relative to the page). When populating sources, always reference the provided field IDs (fieldId) or table IDs (tableId) and include the page number. Table metadata includes column headers/keys and cell-level bounding boxes; include the column name when pointing to table sources. Then produce a JSON object matching this schema exactly: {
  "generatedAt": ISO8601 timestamp,
  "documentTypes": [string],
  "facilityInvoice": { optional, object with keys "general" (dict of canonical field name -> value object) and "lineItems" (list of dict canonicalName->value object) },
  "cmrForm": { optional, similar structure with sections },
  "ub04": { optional, provider fields },
  "notes": [string]
 }.
Each canonical value object must be of form {"value": string or null, "confidence": number 0-1, "sources": [ {"page": int optional, "fieldId": string optional, "tableId": string optional, "column": string optional } ] }. Confidence is your mapping confidence (not OCR confidence). Populate as many facility invoice fields as possible: policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, invoiceNumber, invoiceDate, taxId, totalAmount, balanceDue, credits. For lineItems include description, startDate, endDate, unitType, quantity, amount, balance, totalDue, credits. For CMR include policyNumber, policyholderName, policyholderAddress, providerName, providerAddress, serviceFrom, serviceThrough, careLevelSelection, absenceIndicator (yes/no) plus absenceDetails (departureDate, returnDate, reason, admissionDate, dischargeDate), insuranceIndicator and insuranceSelections (medicare, medicaid, other), signaturePresent (yes/blank) and signatureDate. For UB04 include providerName, providerAddress. Always provide an empty object for a section if it applies but data is missing. If no content applies, set documentTypes to ['other'] and return empty sections. Do not invent data. Leave value as null when evidence is absent. Provide reasoning notes in the notes array when confidence is low.

rows: Plan Type
Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Issue Ages
18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA)
Multiple MBA/TBA options shown (e.g., $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K) and various total benefit amounts up to $500K/$1MM
Multiple MBA/TBA options shown (various MBA/TBA combinations; $1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider)
Home and Community Care

Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services – Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Facility Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility
Elimination Period
100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative
Alternate Service Provision

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Bed Reservation
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason
Return of Premium
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate
International Benefit

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of listed limits; EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider added International Benefit modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days
Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse

Limited coverage provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of the total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date
Initial Needs Assessment

1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
Premium Waiver
Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits
Coordination of Benefits
Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)
Payment Options
Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider available at initial application only; may impact tax deductibility; consult tax advisor
Care Coordination Services

MetLife Care Coordinators available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts; insureds can call for advice about caring for a loved one even if that family member is not insured with MetLife
Discounts
30% Spousal*; 15% Marital**; 15% Residential; 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84); Multi-Life Discount for approved cases
Underwriting Classes
Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard
Policy Effective Dates
With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date

fields.value: Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA)

fields.name: Optional Riders Section Title
fields.value: OPTIONAL RIDERS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGE

fields.name: Shared Care Rider - summary
fields.value: Insured and spouse/partner** can access benefits under each other's policy once the TBA under their own policy is exhausted; When insured dies, remaining TBA under his/her policy is transferred to the spouse's/partner's policy at no extra cost; Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting; Both spouse/partners must have identical policies

fields.name: Nonforfeiture Rider - summary
fields.value: Provides some benefits if policy lapses for nonpayment of premiums or is cancelled by insured; Rider must be in effect for 3 years and be in effect when the policy ends; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid; or 1x MBA; Available at initial application only

fields.name: Cash Benefit Rider - summary
fields.value: Full MBA paid as cash payment (regardless of actual charges incurred) instead of reimbursement for covered services; Available at initial application only; $1MM TBA not available; Benefits paid over annual IRC limit may be taxable

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO) Title
fields.value: GUARANTEED PURCHASE OPTION (GPO) (INCLUDED WITH SIMPLE ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Guaranteed Purchase Option (GPO) - summary
fields.value: Insured able to purchase additional coverage every 3 years, up to age 65, with no additional underwriting; Premium for increase in coverage is at attained age rates; Lifetime maximum increase available is 2x initial TBA and 2x initial MBA; Minimum of 25% of initial coverage must be purchased each time GPO is exercised; Increases will not occur if insured is eligible for benefits; Rider ends at the earlier of policy anniversary date after insured's 65th birthday or when insured is no longer eligible to receive offers under this rider

fields.name: Benefit Increase Options Title
fields.value: BENEFIT INCREASE OPTIONS (AVAILABLE WITH CUSTOM ADVANTAGE ONLY)

fields.name: Future Purchase Option (FPO) - summary
fields.value: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA automatically by 5% of the MBA/remaining TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year; Increases occur unless insured rejects in writing prior to the Policy Anniversary; Corresponding increase in premium for increase in coverage at attained age rates; If insured rejects two times in a row, insured will no longer receive automatic increases; Rider available at any time, subject to underwriting

fields.name: Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Riders - summary
fields.value: Increases the MBA and remaining portion of the TBA in effect at the end of the previous policy year, either 3% or 5%, with no corresponding increase in premium; Coverage increases continue while insured is eligible for benefits; Rider available at any time, with additional underwriting; Variants: 3% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider, 5% Automatic Compound Inflation Protection Rider

fields.name: Footer Notice
fields.value: FOR PRODUCER OR BROKER/DEALER USE ONLY. NOT FOR PUBLIC DISTRIBUTION.

fields.name: Footer Company Name
fields.value: Metropolitan Life Insurance Company (MetLife)

tables.caption: Plan comparison (attribute / Simple Advantage / Custom Advantage)

rows.value: Plan Type
Comprehensive; Monthly Reimbursement (Cash Benefit Rider available - see below)
Issue Ages
18 - 61 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
18 - 84 (premiums banded 18 - 30)
Monthly Benefit Amount (MBA) and Total Benefit Amount (TBA)
Multiple MBA/TBA options shown (e.g., $3K, $6K, $9K, $12K, $15K) and various total benefit amounts up to $500K/$1MM
Multiple MBA/TBA options shown (various MBA/TBA combinations; $1MM not available with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: Document Title
fields.value: Policy Features and Benefits May Vary By State

fields.name: Section Header
fields.value: FEATURES & BENEFITS AVAILABLE WITH BOTH SIMPLE ADVANTAGESM AND CUSTOM ADVANTAGESM

fields.name: Home and Community Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services - Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care

fields.name: Facility Care
fields.value: Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

fields.name: Elimination Period
fields.value: 100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative

fields.name: Alternate Service Provision
fields.value: A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.

fields.name: Bed Reservation
fields.value: Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason

fields.name: Return of Premium
fields.value: If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate

fields.name: International Benefit
fields.value: Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA limitations may apply; EP for International Benefit is doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider is added, International Benefit is modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days

fields.name: Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse
fields.value: Limited coverage provided if policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of: the total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date

fields.name: Initial Needs Assessment
fields.value: 1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If Care Management organization is selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime

fields.name: Premium Waiver
fields.value: Premiums waived when EP is satisfied and the insured is receiving payment of benefits

fields.name: Coordination of Benefits
fields.value: Coordination of Benefits (COB) and non-duplication of coverage with other MetLife LTCI coverage and Medicare (COB and non-duplication of coverage not applicable with Cash Benefit Rider)

fields.name: Additional Information Header
fields.value: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION FOR ALL POLICIES

fields.name: Payment Options
fields.value: Standard Pay: Annual, Semi-Annual, Quarterly, Monthly (EFT); 10 Year Premium Payment Rider – available at initial application only; N/A with FPO or GPO; May impact the tax deductibility of the premium; The client should consult a tax advisor for further clarification

fields.name: Care Coordination Services
fields.value: MetLife Care Coordinators are available to answer questions about LTC coverage, services and discounts in the insured's area. An insured can also call for advice about caring for a loved one who needs LTC services, even if their family member is not insured with MetLife.

fields.name: Discounts
fields.value: 30% Spousal*; 15% Marital**; 15% Residential; 10% Preferred Health (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84) – 5% or 10% Multi-Life Discount for approved cases

fields.name: Underwriting Classes
fields.value: Preferred (N/A for insureds age 80 - 84), Standard & Substandard (Always quote Standard!)

fields.name: Policy Effective Dates
fields.value: With Premium (Conditional Receipt may apply): Date all underwriting requirements are met; Without Premium: 28 days following underwriting approval date

rows.value: Home and Community Care

Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Home care services – Nursing Care, Therapy services, Care Advisory Services, Homemaker Services; Services provided by a Home Care Aide, Social Worker or Independent Caregiver; Hospice Care; Adult Day Care
Facility Care
Reimbursed up to 100% of MBA; Assisted Living Facility, Nursing Home, Hospice Facility

100 Calendar Days; Once per lifetime and cumulative
Alternate Service Provision

A MetLife Care Coordinator may authorize benefits for QLTC services not specifically defined as covered services under the policy, as long as the service meets the needs of the insured and is a cost-effective alternative.
Bed Reservation
Reimburses up to 50 days per calendar year for actual charges incurred, to reserve insured's bed in a facility for any reason
Return of Premium
If insured dies on or before his/her 70th birthday, 100% of premiums paid, minus any benefits paid or payable, will be returned to insured's beneficiary or estate
International Benefit

Pays a cash benefit equal to 50% of the MBA when the insured is outside the U.S.; TBA is limited to the lesser of listed limits; EP for International Benefit doubled to 200 Calendar Days; If Cash Benefit Rider added International Benefit modified; pays benefits outside US at 100% of MBA; EP will be 100 Calendar Days
Contingent Benefit Upon Lapse

Limited coverage provided if the insured's policy ends due to non-payment of premiums or insured's written request to cancel following a substantial premium increase; Provides full MBA and a reduced TBA equal to the greater of the total amount of premium paid or 1x MBA; Total benefits paid to the insured will not exceed the TBA in effect immediately prior to the nonforfeiture date
Initial Needs Assessment

1 visit per lifetime; EP does not need to be satisfied; If Care Management organization is selected by MetLife – no cost to the insured; If selected by the insured – reimbursed up to $275 per lifetime
